alert.note: Alert for Lake; Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 10:32AM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The center of Tropical Storm Ian will emerge off of the Brevard County coast in the next hour, with historic rainfall of 12 to 18 inches reported across east central Florida. These amounts have already caused quick rises along the Saint Johns River. The forecast point at Deland is currently in Minor Flood Stage and is expected to rise to Major Flood Stage this weekend, with a crest of 5.6 feet early next week, which remains below the Flood of Record. Interests along the river should be prepared for major flood impacts to arrive over the next several days. For the St. Johns River...including Deland...Major flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St Johns River Near Deland. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.3 feet, Major flooding occurs to many structures and marinas along the river and in the Hontoon Island area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 4.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM EDT Thursday was 4.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 5.6 feet Tuesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 4.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue St Johns River Deland 4.0 4.3 Thu 9 am 4.9 5.1 5.5 5.5 5.6 &&
